text: Hmmm how many co authors did you have?
I like the look of ShareLaTeX but it's gonna be hard to convince my colleagues in the psychiatry department to start using LaTeX :confused:
Two coauthors, which was pretty easy to manage. All of the authors were comfortable with writing LaTeX, though.
I eased into LaTeX with the LyX editor (<https://www.lyx.org/>), which takes a more structured and friendly approach to LaTeX editing.
But most non-LaTeX academics I've spoken to aren't interested in learning it
damnnn <@U17KXSB7W> shareLaTeX is uber cool. so this is like google doc for latex, right?
yep, multiple people can edit at once, and there's a "show revisions" tab for tracking changes
it also handles compilation for you, which is pretty nice
yeah i’m using it for a project right now - it can be linked to a github repository
I don’t know if it’s just me but it seems like it’d be a lot easier to convince non-techy collaborators to give Authorea a try compared to something like shareLaTeX.
I can't articulate yet why I like shareLaTeX much better, but I just do. So, it’s kind of a dilemma.
